title.narrative: Improving Sustainable Access to Safe Water in Freetown through rehabilitation of the Water Supply System.

description.narrative: This activity (Improving Sustainable Access to Safe Water in Freetown through rehabilitation of the Water Supply System.) is a component of Rehabilitation of Freetown’s Water Supply System reported by FCDO, with a funding type of 'Procurement of goods' and a budget of £44,787,823. This component benefits Sierra Leone, and works in the following sector(s): Water supply - large systems. , with the following implementing partners: IMC Worldwide, Mott MacDonald Limited. The start date is 07-06-2016 and the end date is 30-12-2022.

owner-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO)

mailing-address.narrative: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation - Water, Natural Resource Management and Environment - Water supply and Sanitation - urban water supply
